text: BACK TO POLICIES Supporting text 16.24 For the purposes of this policy, town centre uses include those listed in the NPPF as ‘Main Town Centre Uses’: retail development (including warehouse clubs and factory outlet centres); leisure, entertainment and more intensive sport and recreation uses (including cinemas, restaurants, bars and pubs, nightclubs, casinos, health and fitness centres, indoor bowling centres and bingo halls); offices; and arts, culture and tourism development (including theatres, museums, galleries and concert halls, hotels, and conference facilities). 16.25 Part 1 identifies a series of Primary and Secondary Frontages within the District Centres (as shown on the Policies Map). Primary Frontages include a high proportion of (Class E(a)) retail uses, while Secondary Frontages provide opportunities for a greater diversity of main town centre uses to support the vitality and viability of the town centres.
